title: Dr. Watershed's Environmental Protection Network
description: Track Dr. Watershed through her environmental research activities, discovering how this apparent villain is actually protecting North American watersheds and ecosystems through legitimate scientific monitoring.

briefing.headline: Mysterious Environmental Equipment 'Thefts' Across North America!
briefing.narrativeHtml:
ENVIRONMENTAL ALERT: Dr. Watershed (Sarah Blackfoot), environmental geography specialist, has been 'stealing' water monitoring equipment across North American watersheds. However, intelligence suggests there may be more to this story than meets the eye - her activities appear focused on legitimate environmental protection and research.

Educational Mission: Follow this dedicated environmental scientist from wetland research to national park conservation to academic watershed analysis, learning about North American water systems, environmental monitoring, and the crucial role of scientific research in ecosystem protection!

Challenge Level: Intermediate - requires understanding of North American geography, watershed systems, and environmental monitoring techniques.

rounds.clueHtml:
WETLAND RESEARCH INTELLIGENCE: 'Dr. Watershed photographed conducting comprehensive wetland ecosystem research with advanced water quality testing equipment, pH monitoring devices, and field research gear. She leads diverse community education presentations using topographic maps and tablets displaying environmental data, suggesting expertise in both scientific fieldwork and public outreach.'

ENVIRONMENTAL EVIDENCE: 'Security footage shows her professional approach to wetland conservation, using legitimate research methodology to document ecosystem health. Her combination of sophisticated monitoring instruments and community engagement indicates specialized knowledge of North American wetland systems and their educational importance.'

ECOSYSTEM CHALLENGE: Understand the critical role of wetland ecosystems in North American environmental systems!

rounds.explainHtml: WETLAND RESEARCH CONFIRMED: Dr. Watershed's expertise in wetland ecosystem conservation includes professional water quality monitoring, community education, and legitimate scientific research! Her work protects critical North American water filtration systems and wildlife habitats through evidence-based environmental science.

rounds.clueHtml:
YELLOWSTONE CONSERVATION INTELLIGENCE: 'Surveillance reveals Dr. Watershed at Yellowstone National Park conducting geothermal research with official signage reading "YELLOWSTONE WATERSHED: A LIVING LABORATORY." She operates professional water monitoring equipment, pH testing kits, and scientific instruments while wearing ranger/researcher uniform, indicating authorized conservation research activities.'

NATIONAL PARK EVIDENCE: 'Her specialized equipment for studying unique geothermal ecosystems and water chemistry suggests legitimate national park research programs. The combination of professional conservation protocols and advanced environmental monitoring indicates expertise in protected landscape preservation and scientific study of geothermal watershed systems.'

CONSERVATION CHALLENGE: Understand how national parks serve as living laboratories for environmental research and conservation!

rounds.explainHtml: CONSERVATION RESEARCH CONFIRMED: Yellowstone National Park! rounds.clueHtml:
WATERSHED SYSTEMS ACADEMIC REVELATION: 'Dr. Watershed photographed delivering comprehensive academic presentation about North American watershed systems, using detailed geographic maps showing major river systems including the Mississippi, Columbia, and St. Lawrence watersheds. Her professional presentation includes 3D watershed models and advanced geographic analysis tools demonstrating expertise in continental water system connectivity.'

HEROIC IDENTITY EXPOSED: 'This final evidence reveals the truth: Dr. Watershed is not a villain but a dedicated environmental scientist! Her apparent "equipment thefts" are actually legitimate research activities protecting North American watersheds from pollution and habitat destruction. Her academic expertise serves environmental education and conservation - she has been a hero protecting our water systems all along!'

FINAL CHALLENGE: Understand how major North American watershed systems connect and support continental ecosystems!
